item.description:
NEW HAMPSHIRE SERIES:
Mt. Waumbek and Mt. Cabot ... Two 4,000-Footers!

EVENT ORGANIZER: Julie Moran. Please contact me here with your thoughts and ideas about this trip: jmmoran {{AT}} nycap.rr.com, Mobile 518-281-5882 (please, no phone calls prior to the event). FINISH YOUR NH 48 4,000 LIST WITH US!


ESSENTIAL TRIP DETAILS

Difficulty: Based on group preferences, I am splitting this weekend into two relatively easy day hikes; today's hike is a 9.3-mile loop to Mt. Cabot that includes two other "New England Hundred Highest" peaks, The Horn and The Bulge; total vertical climb is about 2,955 feet. At 1.25 - 1.5 miles per hour, this is about a 7-8 hour hike.

CLICK HERE: Google Maps Trailhead Directions, Distances (link) from where I'm planning to camp along Zealand Road, to the the meetup location at the Unknown Pond Trailhead at the end of York Pond Road, off of Route 110 northwest of Berlin, NH).


Mt Cabot, with The Bulge in front on the right, as seen from The Horn.



TRIP SUMMARY / UPDATES (09/03/2010 4 a.m.): This trip, combined with Mt. Waumbek, is a cross-posted event with the New England Hiking Meetup (NEHM) and the 4 Seasons Hiking Group.

Rick has offered to take over the leadership of this event (thanks Rick!!!). I'm leaving my name on as organizer so as to add my own photos from hiking this trip Wednesday 09-01. These hikes are weather dependent ... please stay close to the website for updates. NOTE: This is a dog-friendly hike.

I've made some changes to this hike. First, my Trip Planner study of Mt. Cabot had errors in it which I fixed; the shortest round-trip to Mt. Cabot is 9.6 miles and, given that, there is no reason not to do the slightly shorter loop that starts at the Unknown Pond Trail to Kilkenny Ridge. This revised plan also includes visits to two other "New England Hundred Highest" peaks, The Horn and The Bulge; visiting these two other peaks only adds about .8 of a mile and 530 feet of climb to the trip, still a fairly easy day.

Here are three new important informational links -- please check them all out, and as always, write me directly with any questions (jmmoran@nycap.rr.com):


LINK 1: ILLUSTRATED WEB PAGE DETAILING THE ROUTE (WAIT UNTIL ALL IMAGES LOAD)

LINK 2: LARGE, MARKED ROUTE MAP

LINK 3: TRIP PLANNER WITH TRAIL SEGMENTS, DISTANCES AND ELEVATION CHANGES.


Please check out the details especially in LINK 1 that has key details and pictures of signs. By doing this trip in advance, I checked everything out in advance for you. Staff at the Berlin Fish Hatchery know you are coming and will be sure to leave the road gate either unlocked or open for you -- you should be out before the 4 p.m. closure time -- but just in case, check in with the hatchery staff and let them know you've arrived. And if the gate is "pin-locked" when you leave, they ask that you please shut the gate behind you.


ESSENTIALS TO BRING: Flash light AND head lamp, food / snacks / at least three bottles of water, first aid items, sunscreen, bug repellent. Wear multiple layers of synthetic materials for warmth; trekking poles may be helpful gear for this hike.


RESEARCH ESSENTIALS:


AREA OVERVIEW -- TRAIL DESCRIPTIONS AND TRIP REPORTS

Link, Area Overview, Peakbagging the 4000 Footer Mountains of New England

Link, Trail Description - Bunnell Notch Trail
Link, Trail Description - Unknown Pond Trail

Link, Up-To-Date Trail Conditions


MT. CABOT
Link, SummitPost Page
Link, Appalachian Mountain Club Page
Link, Hike the Whites
Link, Wikipedia

MT. WAUMBEK
Link, SummitPost Page
Link, Appalachian Mountain Club Page
Link, Hike the Whites
Link, Wikipedia


The treed-in summit of Mt. Cabot.



NOTE: You are responsible for bringing appropriate gear, supplies, clothing, first aid and lights. You should review topographic maps and trail features carefully; understanding topography of any challenge hike is key to your knowing where you are, where you're going and how to get back.

WEATHER AND OTHER SUDDEN EVENTS CAN CAUSE SUDDEN CHANGES TO OR CANCELLATION OF THIS EVENT. YOU MUST CHECK BACK TO THE MEETUP.COM SITE OFTEN FOR UPDATES TO ANY HIKING MATES CHALLENGE EVENT. BY ATTENDING YOU'VE AGREED THAT YOU'VE READ INFORMATION PRESENTED HERE AND AT OUR GUIDELINES -- CLICK THE "ABOUT" LINK AT LEFT.

See you there! Julie.
item.how_to_find_us: Look for the Green Honda Element ...
item.name: NEW HAMPSHIRE SERIES: Mt. Waumbek and Mt. Cabot ... DAY ONE: Cabot
